form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Peters (for himself and Mr. Grassley) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 to require certain disclosures by registrants regarding exemptions under the Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938, as amended.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lobbying Disclosure Improvement Act.

section.header: Registrant disclosure regarding foreign agent registration exemption
section.text: Section 4(b) of the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 (2 U.S.C. 1603(b)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (7), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
a statement as to whether the registrant is exempt under section 3(h) of the Foreign Agents Registration Act of 1938, as amended (22 U.S.C. 613(h)).
